page.title: 19HITCHIN RACIAL MINORITIES
page.content: Taking a stroll about Hitchin you see people with different shades of hair, eyes and skin. Indians' skins are lighter,West Indians' darker. West Indians wear hats, Indians turbans, with very colourful clothes and gold and silver jewellery, mainly bangles and ear-rings. Their eyes are mostly brown. Unusual accents from immigrant communities may be hard to understand. There are shops selling callaloo, ackee, salt fish, yams, sweet potatoes for West Indians and bissan, chapatis, ludu, chillis for Indians. Immigrants from the Caribbean and India still visit relatives in the country they emigrated from. On Sundays Indians worship at temples in Bearton Ave., and Radcliffe Rd. and West Indians at the New Testament Church of God, Bunyan Rd.
